login_central_api_host_clarification: For the purpose of this CTF, the {{CENTRAL_API_HOST}} you will use is: https://breathecode.herokuapp.com/v1. Please use this value when Postman asks for it or when you see {{CENTRAL_API_HOST}} in URLs.
login_step1_launch_postman: Launch Postman (or your preferred API testing tool). If you don't have Postman, you can download it from postman.com/downloads.
login_step2_url_note: (You will need to replace {{CENTRAL_API_HOST}} with the actual API host URL provided by your instructor. This is the same host you use for other 4Geeks Academy APIs.)

login_step3_select_json: From the dropdown menu next to "raw", select "JSON".

login_step6_extract_token: Extract Your Access Token: The value associated with the "token" key is your 4Geeks Access Token. This is a long string of characters. Copy this token carefully.

welcome_subtitle: Your Mission with the HTTP Intercept & Decode Agency Begins Now.
welcome_intro_p1: You are about to embark on a series of challenges designed to test and enhance your understanding of the fundamental protocols that power the web: HTTP and WebSockets. As a new recruit to 4Geeks, your ability to inspect, debug, and understand web communications is paramount.
welcome_outcome_http: Core HTTP Concepts: Master requests, responses, headers, methods, status codes, and cookies.
welcome_outcome_devtools: Browser Developer Tools: Become proficient in using the Network, Console, and Application tabs to dissect web traffic.
welcome_outcome_postman: API Interaction with Postman: Learn to craft requests, manage authentication (e.g., Authorization: Token YOUR_TOKEN), and interpret API responses.
welcome_outcome_debugging: Debugging Techniques: Identify and resolve common issues in web applications by analyzing HTTP traffic and client-side behavior.
welcome_outcome_datalocation: Data Location: Understand where to find critical pieces of information within HTTP messages and browser storage.
welcome_outcome_websockets: (Coming Soon) WebSocket Essentials: Get a foundational understanding of real-time communication.
welcome_intro_p2: Each challenge will present a unique scenario. Your objective is to uncover hidden "flags" by applying your knowledge and the tools provided. Pay close attention to details, think critically, and don't be afraid to experiment.
challenge1_clue: Welcome, Agent. Your first official assignment is to intercept a secure transmission. Use Postman to send a GET request to /api/challenge1-briefing?academy=YOUR_ACADEMY_ID (replace YOUR_ACADEMY_ID with the ID provided). The flag is hidden in a custom HTTP response header named X-4Geeks-Briefing. You'll need your authorization token (e.g., Authorization: Token YOUR_TOKEN) in the request headers.
